intro: Chaerophyllum acuminatum, commonly known as the slender cow parsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist meadows and along stream banks. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with a slender stem that is often hairy. Its flowers, which bloom in early summer, are white or pale green and attract various pollinators. The plant is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
